Greatest common divisor of a finite set

type:
{α : Type u_1} →
  {β : Type u_2} → [inst : CancelCommMonoidWithZero α] → [inst : NormalizedGCDMonoid α] → Finset β → (β → α) → α
name: Finset.gcd
docString: Greatest common divisor of a finite set

For any natural numbers n and even a, n is odd if and only if the remainder of n divided by a is odd.

type: ∀ {n a : ℕ}, Even a → (Odd (n % a) ↔ Odd n)
name: Odd.mod_even_iff
docString: For any natural numbers n and even a, n is odd if and only if the remainder of n divided by a is odd.

The theorem `Nat.bodd_add_div2` states that for any natural number `n`, if `n` is odd (determined by `Nat.bodd n`), then adding `1` to twice the greatest integer smaller than `n/2` (`2 * Nat.div2 n`) gives `n` itself. If `n` is not odd (i.e., even), then adding `0` to twice of `⌊n/2⌋` still gives `n`. Essentially, this theorem is expressing an integer as the sum of an odd/even indicator (1 or 0) and twice a rounded-down half.

type: ∀ (n : ℕ), (bif n.bodd then 1 else 0) + 2 * n.div2 = n
name: Nat.bodd_add_div2
docString: The theorem `Nat.bodd_add_div2` states that for any natural number `n`, if `n` is odd (determined by `Nat.bodd n`), then adding `1` to twice the greatest integer smaller than `n/2` (`2 * Nat.div2 n`) gives `n` itself. If `n` is not odd (i.e., even), then adding `0` to twice of `⌊n/2⌋` still gives `n`. Essentially, this theorem is expressing an integer as the sum of an odd/even indicator (1 or 0) and twice a rounded-down half.

The finset of those partitions in which every part is odd.

type: (n : ℕ) → Finset (Nat.Partition n)
name: Nat.Partition.odds
docString: The finset of those partitions in which every part is odd.

For every natural number `n`, the oddness of `n` and `n+1` are opposite.

type: ∀ (n : ℕ), n.succ.bodd = !n.bodd
name: Nat.bodd_succ
docString: For every natural number `n`, the oddness of `n` and `n+1` are opposite.

This theorem states that a natural number is odd if and only if its remainder when divided by 4 is either 1 or 3. In other words, it characterizes odd numbers in terms of their residues modulo 4.

name: Nat.odd_mod_four_iff
docString: This theorem states that a natural number is odd if and only if its remainder when divided by 4 is either 1 or 3. In other words, it characterizes odd numbers in terms of their residues modulo 4.

No zero divisors.

type: ∀ {α : Type u_2} [self : CanonicallyOrderedCommSemiring α] {a b : α}, a * b = 0 → a = 0 ∨ b = 0
name: CanonicallyOrderedCommSemiring.eq_zero_or_eq_zero_of_mul_eq_zero
docString: No zero divisors.

Greatest common divisor of a multiset

type: {α : Type u_1} → [inst : CancelCommMonoidWithZero α] → [inst : NormalizedGCDMonoid α] → Multiset α → α
name: Multiset.gcd
docString: Greatest common divisor of a multiset

The greatest common divisor between two elements.

type: {α : Type u_2} → [inst : CancelCommMonoidWithZero α] → [self : GCDMonoid α] → α → α → α
name: GCDMonoid.gcd
docString: The greatest common divisor between two elements.

The finset of those partitions in which every part is odd and used at most once.

type: (n : ℕ) → Finset (Nat.Partition n)
name: Nat.Partition.oddDistincts
docString: The finset of those partitions in which every part is odd and used at most once.

The GCD is a divisor of the first element.

type: ∀ {α : Type u_2} [inst : CancelCommMonoidWithZero α] [self : GCDMonoid α] (a b : α), gcd a b ∣ a
name: GCDMonoid.gcd_dvd_left
docString: The GCD is a divisor of the first element.

The greatest common divisor (gcd) of two positive natural numbers,
viewed as positive natural number.

name: PNat.gcd
docString:
The greatest common divisor (gcd) of two positive natural numbers,
viewed as positive natural number.

The GCD is a divisor of the second element.

type: ∀ {α : Type u_2} [inst : CancelCommMonoidWithZero α] [self : GCDMonoid α] (a b : α), gcd a b ∣ b
name: GCDMonoid.gcd_dvd_right
docString: The GCD is a divisor of the second element.

Nonzero divisors have valuation greater than zero.

type:
∀ {R : Type u_1} [inst : CommRing R] [inst_1 : IsDomain R] [inst_2 : IsDedekindDomain R]
  (v : IsDedekindDomain.HeightOneSpectrum R) (x : ↥(nonZeroDivisors R)),
  0 < IsDedekindDomain.HeightOneSpectrum.intValuationDef v ↑x
name: IsDedekindDomain.HeightOneSpectrum.int_valuation_zero_le
docString: Nonzero divisors have valuation greater than zero.

Natural division is always less than division in the field.

type: ∀ {α : Type u_1} [inst : LinearOrderedSemifield α] {m n : ℕ}, ↑(m / n) ≤ ↑m / ↑n
name: Nat.cast_div_le
docString: Natural division is always less than division in the field.

A natural number is odd iff it has residue `1` or `3` mod `4`

name: Nat.odd_mod_four_iff
docString: A natural number is odd iff it has residue `1` or `3` mod `4`

Least common multiple of a finite set

type:
{α : Type u_1} →
  {β : Type u_2} → [inst : CancelCommMonoidWithZero α] → [inst : NormalizedGCDMonoid α] → Finset β → (β → α) → α
name: Finset.lcm
docString: Least common multiple of a finite set

The only divisors of prime powers are prime powers.

type:
∀ {α : Type u_1} [inst : CancelCommMonoidWithZero α] [dec_irr : (p : Associates α) → Decidable (Irreducible p)]
  [inst_1 : UniqueFactorizationMonoid α] [dec : DecidableEq α] [dec' : DecidableEq (Associates α)] {a p : Associates α},
  Irreducible p →
    ∀ [inst_2 : (n : ℕ) → Decidable (a ∣ p ^ n)] {n : ℕ} (h : a ∣ p ^ n),
      a = p ^ Nat.find (_ : ∃ n, (fun n => a ∣ p ^ n) n)
name: Associates.eq_pow_find_of_dvd_irreducible_pow
docString: The only divisors of prime powers are prime powers.

Greatest Common Divisor (GCD) of two `ZNum`s.

type: ZNum → ZNum → Num
name: ZNum.gcd
docString: Greatest Common Divisor (GCD) of two `ZNum`s.

Nonzero divisors have nonzero valuation.

type:
∀ {R : Type u_1} [inst : CommRing R] [inst_1 : IsDomain R] [inst_2 : IsDedekindDomain R]
  (v : IsDedekindDomain.HeightOneSpectrum R) (x : ↥(nonZeroDivisors R)),
  IsDedekindDomain.HeightOneSpectrum.intValuationDef v ↑x ≠ 0
name: IsDedekindDomain.HeightOneSpectrum.int_valuation_ne_zero'
docString: Nonzero divisors have nonzero valuation.

Any quotient group of a divisible group is divisible

type: {A : Type u_2} → [inst : AddCommGroup A] → (B : AddSubgroup A) → [inst_1 : DivisibleBy A ℕ] → DivisibleBy (A ⧸ B) ℕ
name: QuotientAddGroup.divisibleBy
docString: Any quotient group of a divisible group is divisible

**Divisibility by 3 Rule**

type: ∀ (n : ℕ), 3 ∣ n ↔ 3 ∣ List.sum (Nat.digits 10 n)
name: Nat.three_dvd_iff
docString: **Divisibility by 3 Rule**

Any common divisor of both elements is a divisor of the GCD.

type: ∀ {α : Type u_2} [inst : CancelCommMonoidWithZero α] [self : GCDMonoid α] {a b c : α}, a ∣ c → a ∣ b → a ∣ gcd c b
name: GCDMonoid.dvd_gcd
docString: Any common divisor of both elements is a divisor of the GCD.

The sum over the reciprocals of the primes diverges.

type: ¬Summable (Set.indicator {p | Nat.Prime p} fun n => 1 / ↑n)
name: not_summable_one_div_on_primes
docString: The sum over the reciprocals of the primes diverges.
